recipe_name: Neck of lamb with lemon and thyme
author: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall
method: Heat the oil in a heavy-based saucepan. Add the lamb and allow it to sizzle and spit, turning occasionally until lightly browned all over.  Add the lemon juice, thyme, water or stock, a little salt and plenty of pepper. Bring to the boil then turn down the heat to a gentle simmer and place a lid on the pan. Cook gently, turning the meat over occasionally, for about 50 minutes, until the meat is tender. Serve with plenty of good white bread and a perhaps a simple Greek style tomato and onion salad.
ingredients: 2 tbsp olive oil,  1kg/2¼lb scrag end of neck of lamb, on the bone, or chops from the neck end, or both,  juice of 1½  lemons, plus a little thinly pared rind,  6-8 sprigs of thyme,  a wine glass of water, or lamb stock,  salt and fresh ground black pepper,  white bread,  Greek-style tomato and onion salad
